required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Brain Derived Neurotropic Factor Response to Aerobic Exercise Intensity in Depressive Patients.
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Aerobic Exercise Intensity on Affective States and Brain Derived Neurotropic Factor in Patients With Depression

collaborator.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock:
Acute aerobic exercise improves affective stats in patients with mental illnesses. Brain derived neurotropic factor (BDNF) may be a biological mechanism that contributes to the affective benefits. The magnitude of the increase of serum BDNF might be exercise intensity dependent, but no study has compared low high-aerobic-intensity training at 90-95 % of the maximal heart rate (HRmax) with long-slow-distance training at 70 % of the HRmax in patients with depression.
The aim of this study is to compare changes in serum BDNF levels after high-aerobic-intensity training and long-slow-distance training in a intra-individual design in patients suffering from depression. The results will give indications of a possible difference in BDNF response between aerobic intensities and may be uses as pilot data for calculating sample size.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in serum brain derived neurotropic factor (BDNF)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 15 minutes before exercise to 5> minutes after exercise.
primary_outcome.description: To measure serum BDNF levels, blood samples will be taken before and after each workout session.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15 minutes before exercise to 15> minutes after exercise.
secondary_outcome.description: The positive and negative affect schedule (PANAS) .

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15 minutes before exercise and 15> minutes after exercise.
secondary_outcome.description: A short form of state trait anxiety inventory for adults (STAI) is used to detect their state of anxiety.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15 minutes before exercise to 15> minutes after exercise.

arm_group.description: Acute High aerobic intensity training (HIT) and long slow distance training (LSD)

intervention.description: One training session, high aerobic intensity training (HIT) at 90-95 % of the maximal heart rate (HRmax)
One training session, long slow distance training (LSD) at 70 % of the HRmax

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Moderate or severe depression (ICD10: F32-F33)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Bipolar disorder.

facility.name: St.Olavs university Hospital, Departement of Østmarka
